name: Seaglass Cabinet Knob / Drawer Pull
description:
Sea glass knobs add a fun, beachy feel to your cabinets and furniture. Each knob is made from a 1 7/8" square beach glass tile (almost 2" square) and a small accent glass center piece. Each tile has been tumbled to give it smooth, rounded edges. The tile is then permanently affixed to cabinet hardware. The hardware piece has a pewter finish, and includes a standard 8-32 threaded 7/8" screw. The back of the tile has a roughened white surface that is generally not visible when the knob is installed.

Many colors and combinations are available for custom order, see http://www.bitly.com/SeaGlassColors for some additional pieces, specify your choice when ordering. Please feel free to email if you don't see what you're looking for. Price is per knob.

name: Beach Glass Cabinet Knob Furniture Pull
description:
Each Beach Glass Knob is made from a 1 7/8" square glass tile & a small accent glass center piece. Each tile has been frosted and has smooth, rounded edges. The tile is permanently affixed to cabinet hardware. The hardware has a satin nickel finish, & includes a standard 8-32 threaded 1" screw. The back of the tile has a roughened white surface that is generally not visible when the knob is installed.

For colors & options see http://bit.ly/SeaGlassColors . If colors are not specified, Island Blue with Lime Soda accent will be sent. Pricing is per knob. www.beachyrustica.com

name: Recycled Beach Glass Stone Knob
description:
Recycled "Beach Glass" Stone Cabinet Knobs / drawer or furniture pulls bring a natural, rustic look to your kitchen or bath. Each knob is made from a large, chunky, sea foam piece of "beach glass" which is actually recycled glass that has been collected & tumbled in the USA. The glass is 2" to 3" long, 3/4" thick, & each piece is unique. The glass is permanently affixed to high quality hardware. The hardware has a nickel finish, projects 5/8" from the mounting surface before addition of the glass, & includes a standard 8-32 threaded 1" screw.

www.beachyrustica.com
